bio.1: I’m Dania Alnahdi, a student from Bahrain pursuing a BS in Computer Science and Design in Boston, MA. I’m interested in web and software development, inclusive and human-centered technology, and interactive (and pretty) user interfaces.
bio.2: Thanks to my coursework at Northeastern University, industry experience at ASICS Digital and MFS, and the numerious internet rabbit holes I tumble into, I’m always exploring new skills from both the development and design worlds.
bio.3: When I’m not behind my computer, you’ll likely find me advocating for causes I’m passionate about, discovering plant-based food joints, or petting my cat.

project1.name: OneASICS
project1.description: During my ASICS Digital co-op, I primarily worked on OneASICS: the authentication portal used across ASICS' fitness and e-commerce apps. My biggest task was updating the registration's interface and error handling logic, decreasing user errors by 37%.

project2.name: Personal Website
project2.description: This very website! My goal was to create a responsive website from scratch using modern JavaScript tooling. I also added my own illustrations for a more personalized feel.

project3.name: Build for Black Lives
project3.description: An online platform that connects Black businesses and organizations to developers and creatives offering pro bono services. I was able to kickstart and collaborate on this initiative as an organizer for HackBeanpot!

project4.name: Eco Eateries
project4.description: This winning hackathon project is a goal-tracker for restaurants to adopt sustainable business practices. As the only frontend developer on the team, I was in charge of building the user interface, which included an interactive Kanban board.

project5.name: Security Council Database
project5.description: For my Database Design class, I decided to build a full-stack app. Using the database of United Nations data (created by my team), I coded and deployed this directory—which involved creating an API—with the goal of making information on global issues more accessible.

project6.name: Cubby
project6.description: My Interaction Design senior capstone: a learning management system designed for students ages 5-7 in remote and hybrid classes. As a developer on my team, I worked on a live, interactive demo showcasing Cubby's primary and most distinguishing features.

contact.heading: Say hi!
